title: Moscow attack: Tajikistan, the Central Asian country most vulnerable to IS infiltration
summary: Four people of Tajik background were among the alleged perpetrators of Moscow's concert hall attack. Tajik, Uzbek, Turkmen and Kyrgyz nationals make up a large part of Islamic State Khorasan Province, which claimed responsibility for this attack.

title: French PM Gabriel Attal reaffirms goal to reduce deficit by 2027
summary: The French prime minister on Tuesday evening announced plans for spending cuts and unemployment benefit reforms to align with the government's goal of reducing the nation's deficit below 3% of GDP by 2027.

title: Moscow attack: Turkey tracks down numerous active ISIS networks
summary: Turkish police are stepping up operations against individuals suspected of being linked to the Islamic State organization. Two of the Moscow attack's alleged perpetrators are said to have transited through Istanbul.

title: French politicians show support for school head who stepped down in hijab row
summary: The French prosecutor's office has dismissed a complaint made against a high school principal after a student was asked to remove her hijab.

title: Ukraine: Reshuffle at the head of the Security Council
summary: Volodymyr Zelensky dismissed Oleksi Danilov as secretary of the National Security Council and replaced him with the director of the Foreign Intelligence Service.

title: 'By sponsoring coups in the Sahel, Russia has acquired a new hold on Europe: emigration'
summary: In Niger, Vladimir Putin now has a new proxy in an emigration-source country in the Sahel region, observes columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: Macron calls for new EU-South America trade deal
summary: The French president on Wednesday criticized the stagnant EU-Mercosur free trade deal as detrimental to both sides, advocating for a new agreement focused on development and climate.

title: Is Macky Sall to blame for his camp's defeat in the presidential election?
summary: There were concerns even within the presidential party about how Macky Sall behaved during the election campaign, including never publicly endorsing his own candidate.

title: Argentina's Milei downplays atrocities committed by dictatorship on day of remembrance
summary: The Argentine president's office released a video justifying the crimes against humanity committed by the generals' regime in the 1970s and '80s, presenting them as a response to attacks perpetrated by the far-left armed groups of the time.

title: Joe Lieberman, first Jewish candidate to seek US vice presidency, has died at 82
summary: The former US senator of Connecticut, known for his close vice-presidential race on the Democratic ticket with Al Gore in 2000 and nearly being Republican John McCain's running mate in 2008, has passed away, his family announced.

title: Women's Champions League: Lyon advance to semi-finals after 4-1 win over Benfica
summary: Delphine Cascarino and Kadidiatou Diani scored two goals each as record eight-time champion Lyon won 6-2 on aggregate at Groupama Stadium after a 2-1 first-leg win in Portugal.

title: France to help Brazil develop nuclear-powered submarines
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron said that France would partner with Brazil to develop new submarines powered by nuclear technology.

title: France's Assemblée passes bill against foreign interference
summary: The Assemblée Nationale approved the use of online surveillance run by an algorithm in order to monitor suspicious activity and foreign interference.

title: 'Mumbai has become the Asian city with the most billionaires, beating Beijing'
summary: According to the Hurun 2023 ranking, while China still boasts the most billionaires, India's star is rising. The wheel of fortune has turned, but hasn't reduced inequality, writes Le Monde columnist Philippe Escande.

title: Léon Marchand's American dream has led other French swimmers to US shores
summary: Inspired by the Frenchman who has been training in Arizona since 2021 and will compete in the finals of the NCAA championship this week, other French swimmers are set to try the US college experience after the Olympics.

title: In-flight delicacy: France's winemakers aim for the sky
summary: For many French wineries and champagne makers, getting onto airline menus is a major goal. It not only means that they can sell a significant share of their production but also helps them gain international recognition.

title: Germany will now include questions about Israel in its citizenship test
summary: Germany wants to ensure that anti-Semitic people are not granted German nationality and so is adding questions about Israel and the Jewish religion to its citizenship test.

title: At the trial of the 'Tinder rapist,' a plaintiff's outburst: 'You're going to burn!'
summary: Salim Berrada, 38, is on trial before the Paris criminal court, accused of 13 rapes and four sexual assaults. The plaintiffs are infuriated by his stubborn denial.

title: Brazil: Lula bans official commemorations of the 60th anniversary of the coup d'état
summary: The organizations that work to preserve the memory of the crimes of the military dictatorship are outraged by the former opponent's decision, which is also causing a stir within Lula's political party.

title: BlackRock: 'The venerable Larry Fink is worried about pensions'
summary: In his annual letter, the CEO of the world's leading asset manager expressed his concern about pension system failures, which he believes are threatening the economy, particularly in the US.

title: War in Ukraine: Macron's promise to help Kyiv is a budgetary and political headache
summary: The French president had promised 'up to €3 billion' in military support. But with public accounts looking unhealthy, France's Finance Ministry has planned €10 billion in budget cuts.

title: Japanese baseball star Shohei Ohtani entangled in interpreter's misconduct
summary: The reputation of the player, famous for his dual talent as both a pitcher and batter, is at risk due to an investigation into Ippei Mizuhara, a close associate accused of stealing some $4.5 million from Ohtani to cover his gambling debts.

title: DRC: People and animals threatened by fighting in Virunga Park
summary: Africa's oldest park has not been spared the conflict between Rwanda-backed M23 insurgents and Congolese armed forces allied with pro-government groups.

title: Travel: Evian reconnects with its Belle Epoque past
summary: The city on the shores of Lake Geneva is restoring its Art Nouveau heritage that bore witness to the golden age of thermalism. The casino, palaces and 1913 funicular offer a glimpse into the era's opulence and exquisite refinement.

title: For Baltimore, bridge collapse and blocked port is a heavy economic blow
summary: The collision between the container ship Dali and the largest bridge in the Maryland city brings to a standstill a major port for international trade on the East Coast.

title: Moscow attack: 'The Russian population seems doomed to endure the Kremlin's hunt for imaginary threats'
summary: By suggesting that Ukraine was involved in the Crocus City Hall massacre despite the Islamic State organization claiming responsibility for it, Vladimir Putin is perpetuating the logic of a political-military elite that blames the West for all evils, explains Dimitri Minic, a specialist in Russian strategic thinking.

title: China lifts punitive tariffs on Australian wine
summary: In a sign of thawing relations between the two countries, China lifts duties on Australian wine exports. Canberra responded by saying it would drop legal proceedings against China at the WTO.

title: 'The Netanyahu-Biden conflict is indicative of the unease that has crept into Israeli-American relations'
summary: The US's abstention from a UN vote on Monday calling for a ceasefire in Gaza is the latest manifestation of the change in this old relationship, writes columnist Alain Frachon.

title: French lawmakers debate bill to ban hair discrimination
summary: The Assemblée Nationale will examine a bill on March 28 that would add hair discrimination to the list of discriminations that are legally punishable.

title: French lawmakers condemn 1961 Paris massacre of Algerians
summary: Paris police killed dozens in a crackdown on a protest in support of Algerian independence on October 17, 1961. The resolution written by a Green MP with input from the Elysée Palace calls for a day of commemoration.

title: We must protect schools, their staff and users
summary: The principal of a Parisian high school stepped down after receiving death threats. This is worrying. It is yet another warning that the internet can be used to turn the most minor school incident into a pretext for controversy or even an incitation to violence.

title: Palestinian Authority President Abbas approves new government
summary: Mahmoud Abbas, who has led the PA for nearly two decades, approved the new government formed by Prime Minister Mohammad Mustafa.

title: France's Assemblée backs bill against hair discrimination
summary: The bill 'would enable all victims of hair discrimination to use the legislative arsenal,' according to its author, MP Olivier Serva, aiming to combat a phenomenon that mostly targets Black women.

title: France blocks fake Ukraine war enlistment website
summary: A website encouraging French volunteers to join the war in Ukraine mimicked the French army's genuine recruitment portal, the Defense Ministry said.

title: Burst tires: Goodyear's maneuvers to avoid scandal
summary: 'The Goodyear affair' (3/4). During the 2010s, the manufacturer discreetly compensated dozens of accident victims, while demanding their silence. But Sophie Rollet, the widow of a truck driver who died in a 2014 accident provoked by a defective tire, was convinced that the multinational was responsible, and kept investigating.

title: Former FTX crypto tycoon Bankman-Fried gets 25-year sentence
summary: Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of the massive FTX cryptocurrency exchange, had been convicted in November of fraud and conspiracy, and along with the prison sentence has been ordered to forfeit over $11 billion.
